reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: South Africa - Emergency Plant Health Response Plan Launch Meeting

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award South Africa held a meeting to develop emergency preparedness and pest specific contingency plans for plant health pests and diseases. APHIS supported the travel and lodging for participants (provincial plant health directors and laboratory managers) in South Africa's Emergency Plant Health Response Plan Launch Meeting. The meeting served as a launch of the plan for all role players including Provincial Departments of Agriculture and national laboratory units involved in pest detection, monitoring and management. The meeting took place in South Africa and included 20 participants (18 Provincial and 2 national)..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: South Africa continues to be an important strategic partner of the United States. Although it is the second largest economy in Africa, South Africa struggles with serious socioeconomic challenges, including HIV/AIDS and other health concerns, mass unemployment, a failing education system, increasing corruption, poor accountability, and critical levels of violent crime. As South Africa continues to exert leadership in the region, it is working with the United States and other donors to address its social and economic challenges. U.S. investments, in line with South African national development priorities, will target efforts where funding can catalyze innovative approaches for reform and improve efficiency, helping South Africa sustain its democracy and improve the lives of its people

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
